intro: Navarretia philippiana, commonly known as the California star flower, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its small, star-shaped white or pink flowers. The plant typically grows in open, rocky habitats and is often found in coastal areas. It has a low-growing habit with basal leaves and produces numerous small, delicate blooms. Navarretia philippiana is known for its ephemeral nature, blooming briefly after rainfall in spring.
